content.description:
Nasir al-Din Abu al-Abbas Ahmad ibn al-Hajj al-Amin al-Tawathi al-Ghalawi, The Important Stars Among the Multitude of the Heavens, Copied 1733, Timbuktu, Mali
Library of Congress, Mamma Haidara Commemorative Library
This source was written to train scholars in the field of astronomy and includes explanations written in Arabic, the primary language of Islam.
content.question: This document most directly supports which of the following claims?

choices.label: Trade in West Africa drew academics from other regions.
West African kingdoms abandoned trade in favor of educational achievements.
West African societies gained knowledge of astronomy after European colonialism.
Increased trade between West Africa and Asia provided for the spread of religion.

content.answer: Trade in West Africa drew academics from other regions.
